title: Understanding Systems of Linear Equations
text: A system of linear equations is a set of equations where each equation is linear, meaning it involves only constants and variables raised to the first power. These systems can have two or more equations, and they are used to find the values of variables that satisfy all the equations simultaneously.

title: Systems of Linear Equations as Augmented Matrices
text: An augmented matrix is a way of representing a system of linear equations in a compact, matrix form. To do this, the coefficients and constants are arranged into a matrix, regardless of how many variables there are. Zeroes are used to mark empty spots.
